intro: Gutierrezia ramulosa, commonly known as silverleaf gorse, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is shrub-like, with woody stems and small, needle-like leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Gutierrezia ramulosa is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to colonize disturbed sites.
